title: Mathematics for Computer Science - I
summary: Introduces foundational discrete mathematics for computer science, focusing on logic, sets, and combinatorics.

content.description: This course covers fundamental discrete mathematics concepts essential for computer science, including propositional and predicate logic, set theory, functions, relations, and basic combinatorics. It emphasizes proof techniques and problem-solving, preparing students for advanced theoretical courses.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on foundational mathematical concepts used in computer science, with an emphasis on logical reasoning and combinatorial counting.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include logical foundations for programming, algorithm analysis, and discrete system modeling.

title: Mathematics for Computer Science - II
summary: Continues discrete mathematics with a focus on graph theory, number theory, and probability.

content.description: This course builds on CS201, covering graph theory, basic number theory, and discrete probability. It includes topics like graph properties, modular arithmetic, and probability distributions, with applications in algorithm design and network analysis.
bullets: Covers graph theory and its properties
Introduces number theory and modular arithmetic

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on advanced discrete mathematics topics, emphasizing their relevance to computer science.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include network design, cryptographic algorithms, and randomized algorithms.

title: Mathematics for Computer Science - III
summary: Advanced discrete mathematics with a focus on algebraic structures and advanced combinatorics.

content.description: This course advances the study of discrete mathematics, covering algebraic structures (groups, rings, fields), advanced combinatorics, and their applications in computer science. It emphasizes mathematical rigor and applications in coding theory and algorithm design.
bullets: Covers algebraic structures like groups and rings

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on advanced mathematical structures and their computational applications.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include error-correcting codes, cryptographic systems, and combinatorial optimization.

title: Computer Organisation
summary: Explores the design and architecture of computer systems, including processors, memory, and I/O, with a lab component.

content.description: This course covers the principles of computer organization and architecture, including CPU design, memory hierarchy, instruction set architectures, pipelining, and input/output systems. The lab component provides hands-on experience with assembly language programming and hardware simulation.
bullets: Covers CPU design and instruction sets

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on the internal structure and operation of computer systems, with an emphasis on hardware-software interaction.

sections.heading: Lab Component
sections.text: The lab involves practical exercises in assembly language programming and hardware simulation to reinforce theoretical concepts.
bullets: Simulation of CPU and memory systems

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include designing efficient computer systems and optimizing software for hardware performance.

title: Computing Laboratory - I
summary: Introduces practical programming skills through hands-on lab exercises in fundamental computing concepts.

content.description: This course provides hands-on experience in programming, focusing on implementing basic algorithms and data structures using languages like C or Python. It emphasizes problem-solving, debugging, and coding practices, serving as a foundation for advanced programming courses.
bullets: Focuses on programming in C or Python
Covers basic algorithms and data structures

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on practical programming skills through lab-based exercises.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include developing small-scale programs and preparing for advanced computing courses.

title: Computing Laboratory - II
summary: Advances programming skills through lab exercises focusing on complex algorithms and data structures.

content.description: This course builds on CS251, focusing on implementing advanced algorithms and data structures (e.g., trees, graphs) in languages like C++ or Java. It emphasizes efficient coding, testing, and debugging for larger-scale problems.
bullets: Covers advanced data structures like trees and graphs

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on implementing complex algorithms and data structures through lab-based exercises.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include solving complex computational problems and preparing for software development projects.

title: Software Development and Operations
summary: Introduces software development methodologies and operational practices, with a lab component.

content.description: This course covers software development methodologies, including agile and DevOps practices, version control, continuous integration, and deployment. The lab component provides hands-on experience with tools like Git, Docker, and CI/CD pipelines, emphasizing practical software engineering skills.
bullets: Introduces version control and CI/CD pipelines

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on software development and operational practices for building and deploying software systems.

sections.heading: Lab Component
sections.text: The lab involves practical exercises in using software development tools and setting up operational pipelines.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include building scalable software systems and managing deployment pipelines.

title: Computer Science and Engineering Communication Skills
summary: Develops communication skills for CSE students, focusing on technical writing and presentations.

content.description: This course focuses on developing communication skills for CSE students, covering technical writing, presentation skills, and effective collaboration in team projects. It emphasizes clear documentation and communication of technical concepts.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on skills for effective communication in computer science contexts.
bullets: Technical writing for reports and papers

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include writing research papers, presenting project ideas, and collaborating in software teams.

title: Principles of Database Systems
summary: Covers the design, implementation, and management of database systems.

content.description: This course introduces the principles of database systems, including relational models, SQL, normalization, indexing, and transaction management. It covers database design, query optimization, and practical implementation using systems like MySQL or PostgreSQL.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on the theoretical and practical aspects of designing and managing database systems.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include building and querying databases for web applications and data management systems.

title: Operating Systems
summary: Explores the design and implementation of operating systems, including processes, memory, and file systems.

content.description: This course covers the principles of operating systems, including process management, memory management, file systems, and concurrency. It includes practical implementation of OS concepts using tools like Linux kernel programming.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on the design and functionality of operating systems, with an emphasis on system-level programming.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include designing efficient OS components and optimizing system performance.

title: Compiler Design
summary: Covers the theory and practice of designing and implementing compilers for programming languages.

content.description: This course explores the design and implementation of compilers, covering lexical analysis, parsing, semantic analysis, code generation, and optimization. It includes practical projects to build compiler components using tools like LEX and YACC.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on the phases of compiler design and their implementation.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include building compilers and optimizing code for programming languages.
bullets: Tool development with LEX and YACC

title: Theory of Computation
summary: Introduces formal models of computation, including automata, Turing machines, and computability.

content.description: This course covers formal models of computation, including finite automata, pushdown automata, Turing machines, and computability theory. It explores decidability, undecidability, and complexity classes, with a focus on theoretical foundations of computer science.
bullets: Covers finite automata and Turing machines

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on theoretical models of computation and their limits.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include formal language design and theoretical analysis of computational problems.

title: Algorithms II
summary: Advanced study of algorithm design and analysis, building on introductory algorithms.

content.description: This course advances the study of algorithms, covering greedy algorithms, divide-and-conquer, dynamic programming, amortized analysis, NP-completeness, and approximation algorithms. It emphasizes advanced problem-solving and applications in real-world domains.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on advanced algorithm design and analysis techniques with mathematical rigor.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include network optimization, scheduling, and computational problem-solving.

title: Principles of Programming Languages
summary: Explores the design and semantics of programming languages, including functional and object-oriented paradigms.

content.description: This course covers the principles of programming language design, including syntax, semantics, type systems, and paradigms (e.g., functional, object-oriented). It includes practical exploration of languages like Haskell, Java, and Python, focusing on their features and applications.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on the theoretical and practical aspects of programming language design.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include designing domain-specific languages and understanding language implementations.

title: Introduction to Computer Graphics
summary: Introduces the fundamentals of computer graphics, including rendering, modeling, and animation.

content.description: This course covers the basics of computer graphics, including 2D/3D rendering, geometric transformations, shading, and animation. It includes practical projects using tools like OpenGL to implement graphics algorithms.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on the theoretical and practical aspects of computer graphics.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include game development, visualization, and computer-aided design.

title: Artificial Intelligence
summary: Introduces core concepts of artificial intelligence, including search, knowledge representation, and machine learning.

content.description: This course introduces artificial intelligence, covering search algorithms, knowledge representation, reasoning, and introductory machine learning. It includes practical implementations of AI techniques in areas like games and expert systems.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on foundational AI techniques and their theoretical underpinnings.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include AI for games, expert systems, and decision-making systems.

title: Undergraduate Project - I (UGP-1)
summary: First part of a year-long undergraduate research or development project in CSE.

content.description: This course involves independent or team-based research or development projects under faculty supervision, focusing on applying CSE concepts to practical problems. Students define a problem, conduct preliminary research, and develop initial solutions.

sections.heading: Core Activities
sections.text: Focuses on defining and starting a project in computer science, with an emphasis on research or development.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications vary based on project topics, including software development, algorithm design, or system analysis.

title: Undergraduate Project - II (UGP-2)
summary: Continuation of UGP-1, focusing on implementation and evaluation of the project.

content.description: This course continues UGP-1, focusing on implementing, testing, and evaluating the project defined in the first part. Students refine solutions, conduct experiments, and prepare a final report under faculty supervision.

sections.heading: Core Activities
sections.text: Focuses on completing the project, with an emphasis on implementation and evaluation.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications depend on project scope, including software systems, algorithms, or theoretical studies.

title: Special Topics in Computer Science
summary: Explores emerging or specialized topics in computer science, varying by semester.

content.description: This course covers emerging or specialized topics in computer science, tailored to current research or industry trends. Topics vary by semester and instructor, potentially including areas like blockchain, quantum computing, or advanced AI techniques.
bullets: Focuses on research or industry trends

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on specialized or cutting-edge areas in computer science, based on instructor expertise.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications depend on the semesterâ€™s focus, including research prototypes or industry solutions.

title: Computer Architecture
summary: Advanced study of computer architecture, focusing on processor design and performance optimization.

content.description: This course advances the study of computer architecture, covering advanced processor design, memory systems, and performance optimization techniques. It includes topics like superscalar processors, cache coherence, and parallel architectures.
bullets: Explores cache coherence and memory systems

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on advanced architectural concepts and their implementation.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include designing high-performance computing systems and optimizing software for hardware.

title: Multi-core and Multiprocessor Architecture
summary: Explores the design and optimization of multi-core and multiprocessor systems.

content.description: This course focuses on multi-core and multiprocessor architectures, covering parallel processing, cache coherence, interconnection networks, and performance optimization. It includes practical exercises in programming for multi-core systems.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on the design and operation of multi-core and multiprocessor systems.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include high-performance computing and parallel software development.

title: Computer Networks
summary: Covers the principles and protocols of computer networks, including TCP/IP and network security.

content.description: This course introduces computer networks, covering network architectures, protocols (e.g., TCP/IP, HTTP), routing, and security. It includes practical exercises in network programming and configuration.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on the design and operation of computer networks, with an emphasis on protocols and security.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include designing and securing network systems for various domains.

title: Parallel Programming
summary: Introduces parallel programming techniques for multi-core and distributed systems.

content.description: This course covers parallel programming paradigms, including shared-memory and distributed-memory models, using tools like OpenMP and MPI. It emphasizes designing and optimizing parallel algorithms for performance.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on techniques for programming parallel systems and optimizing performance.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include high-performance computing and parallel data processing.

title: Introduction to Software Engineering
summary: Covers software engineering principles, including design, testing, and project management.

content.description: This course introduces software engineering principles, covering software development life cycles, design patterns, testing methodologies, and project management. It includes practical projects to apply these concepts in real-world scenarios.
bullets: Includes project management and practical projects

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on the principles and practices of software engineering.
bullets: Software development life cycles (e.g., Agile, Waterfall)

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include developing robust software systems and managing software projects.

title: Undergraduate Project - I (UGP-1) (>=Y22)
summary: First part of a year-long undergraduate project for students starting from Y22 batch.

content.description: This course, for students starting from the Y22 batch, involves independent or team-based research or development projects under faculty supervision. Students define a problem, conduct preliminary research, and develop initial solutions in computer science.
bullets: Focuses on problem definition and initial solutions

sections.heading: Core Activities
sections.text: Focuses on initiating a project, with an emphasis on research or development.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications vary based on project topics, including software development, algorithms, or systems.

title: Undergraduate Project - II (UGP-2) (>=Y22)
summary: Continuation of UGP-1 for Y22 batch, focusing on project implementation and evaluation.

content.description: This course continues UGP-1 for students starting from the Y22 batch, focusing on implementing, testing, and evaluating the project. Students refine solutions, conduct experiments, and prepare a final report under faculty supervision.

sections.heading: Core Activities
sections.text: Focuses on completing the project, with an emphasis on implementation and evaluation.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications depend on project scope, including software systems, algorithms, or theoretical studies.

title: Undergraduate Project - III (UGP-3)
summary: Third part of an extended undergraduate project, focusing on advanced development and analysis.

content.description: This course extends the undergraduate project sequence, focusing on advanced development, analysis, and refinement of the project. Students work on complex aspects of their project, integrating advanced techniques under faculty supervision.
bullets: Focuses on advanced development and analysis

sections.heading: Core Activities
sections.text: Focuses on advanced project development and in-depth analysis.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include advanced software systems, algorithmic research, or system optimization.

title: Undergraduate Project - IV (UGP-4)
summary: Final part of the undergraduate project sequence, focusing on project completion and presentation.

content.description: This course concludes the undergraduate project sequence, focusing on finalizing the project, conducting comprehensive evaluations, and presenting results. Students prepare a detailed report and presentation under faculty supervision.
bullets: Focuses on project completion and presentation

sections.heading: Core Activities
sections.text: Focuses on finalizing the project and presenting results.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include finalized software systems, research outcomes, or system optimizations.

title: Mathematics for Computer Science
summary: Advanced mathematical foundations for computer science, tailored for postgraduate students.

content.description: This course provides advanced mathematical foundations for postgraduate computer science studies, covering topics like advanced graph theory, linear algebra, probability, and combinatorics, with applications in algorithms and theoretical computer science.
bullets: Covers advanced graph theory and linear algebra

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on advanced mathematical concepts relevant to computer science research.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include algorithm design, machine learning, and theoretical computer science.

title: Design and Analysis of Algorithms
summary: Advanced study of algorithm design and analysis for postgraduate students.

content.description: This course covers advanced algorithm design techniques, including dynamic programming, greedy algorithms, approximation algorithms, and randomized algorithms. It emphasizes rigorous analysis and applications in complex computational problems.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on advanced algorithm design and analysis for postgraduate research.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include optimization, network design, and computational biology.

title: Fundamentals of Theoretical Computer Science
summary: Covers foundational concepts in theoretical computer science, including automata and complexity.

content.description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to theoretical computer science, covering automata theory, computability, and complexity theory. It includes finite automata, Turing machines, and complexity classes like P and NP, tailored for postgraduate students.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on foundational theoretical concepts and their implications.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include formal language design and computational complexity analysis.

title: Programming for Performance
summary: Focuses on techniques for optimizing program performance in high-performance computing.

content.description: This course explores techniques for optimizing program performance, including profiling, parallelization, and memory optimization. It covers tools and methodologies for high-performance computing, with practical applications in software development.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on methods to enhance program efficiency and performance.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include optimizing software for scientific computing and large-scale systems.

title: Linux Kernel Programming
summary: Covers the design and implementation of Linux kernel modules and drivers.

content.description: This course focuses on Linux kernel programming, covering kernel architecture, module development, device drivers, and system calls. It includes practical exercises in writing and debugging kernel code.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on the design and programming of Linux kernel components.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include developing custom kernel modules and optimizing system performance.

title: Skyline Queries in Database
summary: Explores skyline query processing in databases for multi-criteria decision-making.

content.description: This course covers skyline queries, which identify optimal data points based on multiple criteria in databases. It includes algorithms for skyline computation, indexing techniques, and applications in decision support systems.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on the theory and implementation of skyline query processing.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include decision support systems and data analysis in large databases.

title: Human Centered Computing
summary: Explores user-centered design and evaluation of computing systems.

content.description: This course focuses on human-centered computing, covering user interface design, usability evaluation, and human-computer interaction principles. It includes practical projects in designing user-friendly systems.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on designing and evaluating computing systems with a user-centric approach.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include designing intuitive software interfaces and improving user experiences.
bullets: HCI in mobile and web systems

title: Database Queries
summary: Covers advanced database query processing and optimization techniques.

content.description: This course explores advanced database query processing, including query optimization, indexing, and distributed query execution. It covers SQL extensions, query rewriting, and performance tuning in modern database systems.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on advanced techniques for efficient query processing in databases.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include optimizing large-scale database systems and data analytics platforms.

title: Indexing and Searching Techniques in Databases
summary: Focuses on indexing and searching methods for efficient database query execution.

content.description: This course covers advanced indexing and searching techniques in databases, including B-trees, hash indexes, and full-text search. It explores methods for optimizing query performance in large-scale database systems.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on indexing and searching methods to enhance database performance.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include search engines, database optimization, and data retrieval systems.

title: Advances in DBMS
summary: Explores advanced topics in database management systems, including distributed and NoSQL databases.

content.description: This course covers advanced topics in database management systems, including distributed databases, NoSQL databases, and big data management. It explores scalability, consistency, and performance optimization in modern database systems.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on advanced database technologies and their implementation.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include large-scale data analytics and cloud-based database systems.

title: Topics in Contemporary Microarchitecture
summary: Explores modern microarchitecture designs and their performance implications.

content.description: This course covers contemporary microarchitecture topics, including advanced processor designs, speculative execution, and energy-efficient architectures. It focuses on recent advancements and their impact on system performance.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on cutting-edge microarchitecture designs and their performance characteristics.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include high-performance and low-power computing systems.

title: Advanced Computer Architecture
summary: Advanced study of computer architecture, focusing on high-performance and parallel systems.

content.description: This course delves into advanced computer architecture topics, including parallel architectures, GPU architectures, and memory system optimizations. It emphasizes designing and analyzing high-performance computing systems.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on advanced architectural designs for high-performance systems.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include designing high-performance computing systems and GPU-based applications.

title: VLSI Design for Parallel Architectures
summary: Covers VLSI design techniques for implementing parallel architectures.

content.description: This course explores VLSI design for parallel architectures, focusing on hardware implementation of parallel processing units, memory systems, and interconnection networks. It includes practical design projects using VLSI tools.
bullets: Covers VLSI design for parallel systems

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on designing VLSI circuits for parallel computing systems.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include designing parallel computing hardware and optimizing VLSI systems.

title: Topics in Embedded Systems
summary: Explores advanced topics in embedded systems design and implementation.

content.description: This course covers advanced topics in embedded systems, including real-time systems, low-power design, and embedded software development. It includes practical projects in designing and programming embedded systems.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on advanced techniques for designing and programming embedded systems.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include IoT devices, automotive systems, and embedded control systems.

title: Advanced Computer Networks
summary: Advanced study of computer networks, focusing on modern protocols and network management.

content.description: This course explores advanced topics in computer networks, including modern protocols, network virtualization, and software-defined networking (SDN). It covers network management, security, and performance optimization.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on advanced network architectures and management techniques.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include designing scalable and secure network systems.

title: Fault Tolerant Computing Systems
summary: Covers techniques for designing fault-tolerant computing systems.

content.description: This course explores fault tolerance in computing systems, covering redundancy, error detection, and recovery mechanisms. It includes techniques for designing reliable systems in hardware and software.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on techniques for building reliable computing systems.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include designing reliable distributed systems and critical infrastructure.

title: E-commerce
summary: Explores the design and implementation of e-commerce systems and technologies.

content.description: This course covers the design and implementation of e-commerce systems, including web architectures, payment systems, and security protocols. It includes practical projects in building e-commerce platforms.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on the technologies and architectures for e-commerce systems.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include building secure and scalable e-commerce platforms.

title: Computer Systems Security
summary: Covers security mechanisms and threats in computer systems, including software and hardware vulnerabilities.

content.description: This course examines security in computer systems, covering software vulnerabilities (e.g., buffer overflows), hardware security, and system-level defenses. It includes practical exercises in securing systems and analyzing threats.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on identifying and mitigating security threats in computer systems.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include securing operating systems, applications, and hardware platforms.

title: Parallel Execution of Programs
summary: Explores techniques for parallel program execution on modern architectures.

content.description: This course covers techniques for parallel program execution, including parallelization strategies, synchronization, and performance optimization on multi-core and distributed systems. It includes practical parallel programming projects.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on methods for executing programs in parallel on modern architectures.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include parallel computing in scientific simulations and data processing.

title: Advanced Operating Systems For Embedded Systems, Pervasive Computing and Internet Of Things
summary: Covers advanced operating system concepts for embedded systems, pervasive computing, and IoT.

content.description: This course explores advanced operating system concepts tailored for embedded systems, pervasive computing, and IoT. It covers real-time OS, lightweight kernels, and IoT-specific OS designs, with practical projects in system development.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on OS designs for resource-constrained and pervasive computing environments.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include IoT devices, automotive systems, and pervasive computing environments.

title: Cyber security of critical infrastructure
summary: Focuses on securing critical infrastructure systems against cyber threats.

content.description: This course examines cybersecurity for critical infrastructure, covering threat models, vulnerability analysis, and defense mechanisms for systems like power grids and transportation networks. It includes practical exercises in securing infrastructure systems.
bullets: Covers threat models for critical infrastructure

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on identifying and mitigating cyber threats to critical infrastructure.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include securing power grids, transportation, and other critical systems.

title: Topics in Distributed Systems
summary: Explores advanced topics in distributed systems, including consistency and fault tolerance.

content.description: This course covers advanced topics in distributed systems, including distributed consensus, fault tolerance, and scalability. It includes practical projects in designing and implementing distributed system components.
bullets: Covers distributed consensus and fault tolerance

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on advanced concepts in designing and managing distributed systems.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include cloud computing, distributed databases, and large-scale systems.

title: Parallel Computing
summary: Covers principles and techniques of parallel computing systems and algorithms.

content.description: This course explores parallel computing, including parallel architectures, programming models, and algorithm design. It emphasizes efficient parallelization techniques for high-performance computing.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on the design and implementation of parallel computing systems.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include scientific computing, data processing, and machine learning.

title: Mobile Computing
summary: Explores the principles and technologies of mobile computing systems and applications.

content.description: This course covers the fundamentals of mobile computing, including mobile architectures, wireless communication protocols, mobile app development, and energy-efficient design. It includes practical projects in developing mobile applications.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on the design and implementation of mobile computing systems.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include mobile apps, IoT integration, and location-based services.

title: Approximation Algorithms
summary: Covers the design and analysis of approximation algorithms for NP-hard problems.

content.description: This course explores approximation algorithms for solving NP-hard problems, focusing on techniques like greedy, linear programming relaxations, and randomized rounding. It emphasizes performance guarantees and practical applications.
bullets: Covers approximation techniques for NP-hard problems

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on designing and analyzing approximation algorithms with provable guarantees.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include scheduling, network optimization, and combinatorial problems.

title: Analysis of Concurrent Programs
summary: Focuses on techniques for analyzing and verifying concurrent programs.

content.description: This course covers methods for analyzing concurrent programs, including concurrency models, deadlock detection, and formal verification. It emphasizes tools and techniques for ensuring correctness in multi-threaded systems.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on analyzing and ensuring the correctness of concurrent programs.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include verifying distributed systems and multi-threaded software.

title: Embedded and Cyber-Physical Systems
summary: Explores the design and implementation of embedded and cyber-physical systems.

content.description: This course covers the design and implementation of embedded and cyber-physical systems, focusing on real-time constraints, hardware-software co-design, and sensor integration. It includes practical projects in embedded system development.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on the design and implementation of embedded and cyber-physical systems.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include IoT, automotive systems, and robotics.

title: Computational Complexity
summary: Covers advanced topics in computational complexity theory.

content.description: This course explores advanced topics in computational complexity, including time and space complexity, complexity classes, and reducibility. It emphasizes theoretical foundations and their implications.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on advanced theoretical aspects of computational complexity.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include algorithm design and theoretical computer science.

title: Advanced Automata Theory
summary: Covers advanced topics in automata theory and formal languages.

content.description: This course explores advanced topics in automata theory, including pushdown automata, context-sensitive languages, and advanced computational models. It emphasizes formal language theory and applications.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on advanced automata and formal language theory.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include compiler design and formal verification.

title: Advanced Automata Theory
summary: Covers advanced topics in automata theory and formal languages.

content.description: This course explores advanced topics in automata theory, including pushdown automata, context-sensitive languages, and advanced computational models. It emphasizes formal language theory and applications.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on advanced automata and formal language theory.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include compiler design and formal verification.

title: Circuit Complexity Theory
summary: Explores circuit complexity and its implications in computational theory.

content.description: This course covers circuit complexity, including Boolean circuits, circuit lower bounds, and their applications in computational complexity. It emphasizes theoretical analysis and implications.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on the theoretical aspects of circuit complexity.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include algorithm design and cryptographic systems.

title: Abstract State Machines
summary: Covers abstract state machines and their applications in system modeling.

content.description: This course explores abstract state machines (ASMs) for modeling and verifying complex systems. It includes ASM specification, refinement, and applications in system design.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on modeling and verifying systems using abstract state machines.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include system design and formal verification.

title: Finite Automata on Infinite Inputs
summary: Explores finite automata for infinite input sequences.

content.description: This course covers finite automata on infinite inputs, including BÃ¼chi automata, omega-regular languages, and their applications in verification and reactive systems.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on automata for infinite input sequences and their applications.

sections.heading: Applications
sections.text: Applications include formal verification and system modeling.

title: Topics in Complexity Theory
summary: Explores advanced topics in computational complexity theory.

content.description: This course covers advanced topics in complexity theory, including interactive proofs, zero-knowledge proofs, and quantum complexity. It emphasizes theoretical advancements and their implications.

sections.heading: Core Topics
sections.text: Focuses on advanced concepts in computational complexity.

title: Advanced Topics in Algorithms and Data Structures

sections.text: Focuses on logical systems and their applications in computer science.
